notes: Summary: On a titanium mining platform several million miles from Earth, an engineer dying from an unknown radiation dreams of the Mohave Desert. When he dies a big cactus grows there overnight.

notes: Summary: Just asking about being conscious proves you're not dreaming.

165.heading: Dreaming.
165.title: REM
165.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: The toys surrounding a boy who has fallen asleep while playing in his room reappear as he dreams.

166.heading: Dreaming.
166.title: "Spirit in the Stone" 5 p. in Chamber of Chills Magazine, no. 5
166.author: [No author]
notes: "After the thing fell from the skies, one man dreamed of good, the other of evil, but neither man had reckoned with the consequences of tinkering with that horrible life force."

167.heading: Dreaming.
167.title: "Star Light, Star Bright"
167.author: Johnny Craig, story and art
167.appears_in: p. 140-148 in Those Were the Terrible, Shocking, Sensational, Appalling, Forbidden, But Simply Wonderful Horror Comics of the 1950's (New York : Nostalgia Press, 1971).
notes: Reprinted from The Vault of Horror, no. 34 (Dec./Jan. 1954).
The new master of an insane asylum dreams he's in a coffin, or is it a dream?

168.heading: Dreaming.
168.title: "Stay on the Safe Side"
168.author: by Holloway.
notes: Summary: Sunny Boy dreams about the law, and checks his dream book to find what numbers he should play.

169.heading: Dreaming.

169.author: by Unger

notes: Summary: Speaking to her husband at bedtime, she's holding a hammer and a large wooden stake.

173.heading: Dreaming.
173.title: "Zora"
173.author: by Fernando Fernandez
173.appears_in: p. 40-43 in Heavy Metal, v. 7, no. 2 (May 1983).
notes: "So far: Under the auto-medic's recuperative care, Amon dreams, his unconscious mind reaching for a moment in his past. His partners-in-arms watch a projection of his dream, seeing him awakened from hibernation and saved from death by an unknown entity that allowed him a glimpse of his future."
